title: [PoC] Resolve minified react errors in Devtools using SVG images
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** Feature

**What is the current behavior?** Currently when React is in production mode, all errors thrown display a link to view the "unminified" error.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13242392/40462785-7091308a-5f09-11e8-8d0e-219edd7ece1e.png)

By utilizing Chrome's custom formatter, and the `background-image` attribute, it's possible to load an image from a custom URL.

Using an SVG and some `<text>` nodes, it's possible to re-create the full error message.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13242392/40462887-eddc58ee-5f09-11e8-90a2-9dc18b0f0d65.png)

Proof of concept: https://codesandbox.io/embed/j5k3yo879?expanddevtools=1


This would require a server to parse the error messages and output an SVG, but would:

- Provide concise error messages without having to leave DevTools 
- Wouldn't affect the existing bundle size
- No side-effects, ie. the SVG's only load if DevTools is open
- Retains the same behaviour for other browsers (such as Firefox Devtools), which doesn't support displaying images
